The fishermen caught a glimpse of something...
...something unusual.
Down past the lighthouse.
Your mother has gone?
Oh I'm sure she'll be back
I haven't seen her myself I'm afraid.
What a miserable day!
The lighthouse is on the blink as well!
No boats can can come inshore...
...until it's working again.
What a bother!
Wow, the skies have cleared...
...what a beautiful day.
Now if only I could figure out...
...What is wrong with the lighthouse...
Then the fishermen would know where to come!
We used to turn on the power in the basement...
chinese: 以前我們只需要去地庫打開開關……

english: ...but the entrance has long been blocked.
There is another secret entrance, but...
chinese: 是有另一個秘密入口，只不過……

english: ...that comes out a long way from here.
The light has come on!
Finally the boats can come in to harbor.
Hey Hue, it was you?
You turned the power back on?
Well I'll be. Thank you!
The fishermen are back now...
...they got quite lost I believe!
chinese: ……我肯定他們之前完全迷失方向！

english: Now the lighthouse is working...
...boats can come and go again!
If you need a ride anywhere...
I'm sure the fishermen will oblige!
chinese: 我肯定漁夫們會幫你一把！

english: You'd think keeping a lighthouse would be easy...
chinese: 大家都以為管理燈塔是分好差事……

english: But with the power going out...
...and the basement getting blocked...
...well... it's been quite stressful!
I need a nice cup of tea, and a snooze.
chinese: 我需要喝一杯茶，然後小睡片刻。

english: Your mother is back, Hue!
Wonderful!
What a relief it must be.
chinese: 很高興你能放下心頭大石。

english: My mother left long ago.
I'm so pleased you were able to find yours.
chinese: 你能找回媽媽，我為你感到高興。

english: Make sure you make the most of it, Hue.
chinese: 要好好珍惜這次重逢，瑟調。

english: First, the lighthouse, now your mother...
chinese: 先是攞平燈塔，然後找回媽媽……

english: ...what a remarkable day!
I hope this spell of good luck continues!
chinese: 希望這個好運氣會持續下去！

english: Hellooooo?
Hue is that you?
Thank goodness, I've been trapped for days!
chinese: 謝天謝地，我在這兒困了數天！

english: Help me get out of here!
I keep hearing noises! It's creeping me out!
chinese: 我一直聽到聲音，快要發瘋了！

english: The rocks... they...
they... just disappeared?
I don't know how you did it?
chinese: 我不知你是怎樣做到的。

english: Who cares! I'm saved!
Thank you!
Oh, hey again Hue!
Thanks so much for saving me earlier!
Those caves sure gave me the creeps.
chinese: 那洞穴真的令我嚇破了膽。

english: I don't know how much longer I would have lasted...
chinese: 真不知道當時還能撐多久。

english: ...the rocks had trapped me in!
What a pickle!
How did you do it though, Hue?
chinese: 那你是如何做到的，瑟調？

english: You made the rocks... just vanish.
chinese: 我指，你就那樣……變走了岩石。

english: Was it magic... witchcraft?
Perhaps you can make my bills disappear too...
chinese: 如果你能變走我的付款單……

english: ...wouldn't that be something!
Hey Hue! You saved your mother too?
chinese: 嘿，瑟調！你今次救出了媽媽？

english: Or did she save you?
It must be your new...
...mysterious powers, woOOoo.
I told your mother about how you saved me...
chinese: 我告訴了你的媽媽，說你如何救出我。

english: she was so proud!
Rightfully so, I owe you a beer...
...I mean a juice!
I'm hanging up my mining boots for good!
chinese: 我掛靴了。再也不掘礦了。

english: I never found anything anyway...
chinese: 反正我從沒掘到些甚麼……

english: ...I might look for shells on the beach instead.
Oh hello there!
You startled me...
I'm just resting my legs...
Don't play too close to the water now!
I've heard there are caves through the waterfall...
chinese: 我聽說過，瀑布後面有洞穴……

english: ...apparently they stretch for miles.
chinese: ……一個又一個洞穴，連綿不斷、沒有盡頭。

english: I would never go myself though.
It's far too dangerous!
I come down here to collect water sometimes...
...it's much nicer than from the well.
Isn't the sound of water relaxing?
I could just sit here and listen all day.
chinese: 我可以坐在這兒聽一整天。

english: Hello again Hue.
Great to see you and your mother are safe!
chinese: 很高興你跟你的媽媽平安再會！

english: Hopefully we'll cross paths...
chinese: 說不定我們也會再次巧遇……

english: ...maybe we can visit that waterfall again.
I had no idea when we last met, down by the waterfall...
chinese: 上次在瀑布邊遇見你時，我完全沒想過……

english: ...that you were going on such an adventure!
How exciting!
I would offer you a drink, but it's my last bottle!
chinese: 我想請你喝一杯茶，但我的水不夠了。

english: I need to take another trip to the waterfall.
Maybe another day... today has been so busy!
Hey watch it buddy!
Stop that!
How could you be so heartless!
Skeletons hanging over here!
chinese: 本骨懸若日月，不會動搖！

english: Quit it!
I'd come down there...
...but I don't have the guts!
You're not getting under my skin!
You're making me queasy...
I don't have the stomach for it.
Oh hey, you!
You're not supposed to be here!
The University is closed...
The pipes have burst, there's slime everywhere!
chinese: 水管爆裂了，到處都是污水！

english: Best be on your way.
I won't say it again!
The University is closed!
Away with you!
Aren't you a bit young to be at University anyway?
chinese: 況且大學本來就不是豆丁來的地方吧？

english: I must be getting old.
Now get out of here, before I lose my patience!
chinese: 好了快點出去，別要我發脾氣！

english: Come on kid, I'm trying to mop up here.
chinese: 求求你了小豆丁，我只是個清潔工。

english: Don't cause a scene, I'm just doing my job.
chinese: 別令我難做好嗎，我只是打工的。

english: Now scram!
Okay, if you're going to hassle me, how about a joke?
chinese: 好，既然你堅持不走，那就聽我說一個笑話吧？

english: What did the janitor say when he jumped out the closet?
chinese: 大學生首天上班，要負責清潔。他說，我是名大學生！

english: Supplies!
chinese: 清潔工聽了說，抱歉原來你是大學生。讓我教你掃地。

english: Huehuehue...
Now scoot!
Hey little landlubber!
I'm just dropping off the catch.
You need to get to the University?...
...I'm setting sail shortly!
Hop inside and I'll give you a ride!
Not long until we set sail!
Thank goodness the lighthouse is working now...
chinese: 燈塔沒事實在是太好了……

english: ...I was sailing around in circles!
We'll raise anchor when you're ready!
chinese: 等你準備好我們就出發！

english: Nice day for a spot of sailing!
chinese: 今天是適宜出海的好天！

english: Step inside and we'll hit the seas!
Phew, that was a rough ride!
Looks like you found your sea legs though.
The University is up in the mountains...
There should be a cable car, at the base of the mountain.
Otherwise you'll have a rocky climb!
chinese: 不然就只能攀岩登山了！

english: If you head East, you should see a sign for the University.
chinese: 往東走，就會看見大學的路牌。

english: It shouldn't take you long to get there.
I'll be here a while, so take your time.
chinese: 我會逗留一段時間，你可以慢慢來。

english: It's a bit chilly isn't it?
I need to get a better coat.
Those seals have the right idea.

chinese: 天天吃魚吃得又圓又胖。

english: They look pretty warm under all that blubber.
chinese: 被那麼多脂肪包著一定很暖。

english: Did you hear about the red ship that collided with the blue ship?
chinese: 聽說紅船跟藍船撞在一起了……

english: All the sailors were marooned!
chinese: 全部船員都漂流到了不知那兒！

english: Well I'll be... look who it is!
chinese: 時候也不早了……呀，看誰來了！

english: It's wonderful to see you both again!
I never doubted you'd find each other.
chinese: 我沒有懷疑過你們能不能重逢。

english: You both look exhausted... let me fire up the 'ol vessel.
chinese: 你們看上去都累了……讓我發動引擎。

english: I'll get you back to the village in no time.
chinese: 眨眼的功夫就能帶你們回去。

english: Hey little landlubber!
It's so great to see you two reunited.
You both slept the whole way back.
You must have been so tired!
I can take you back to the University...
...did you leave something behind?
I'm ready when you are!
It's a clear sky, perfect for a quick sail!
chinese: 萬里無雲，最適合出海不過！

english: Feel free to jump aboard.
I need someone to scrub the deck!
Good morning Hue!
Isn't it great to be home...
...everything is back the way it should be.
When we arrived...
...everyone was so pleased to see us!
I suppose, I kind of took our friends for granted...
chinese: 我想，我忽略了我們的朋友……

english: ...I was too caught up in my research.
I think my researching days are over...
...or at least, I'm going to take a hiatus.
Never say never...
...even after everything we've been through!
Wow, you're a long way from home, kid!
chinese: 嘩，孩子，你怎麼會在這兒？

english: What are you doing all the way down here?
chinese: 山長水遠的，你走來幹甚麼？

english: I've just got this generator working.
The lights have turned on!
I read stories about an ancient civilisation...
chinese: 我讀過一本書說有個遠古文明……

english: ...building great machines, many years ago.
chinese: ……在很久以前做了很多偉大的機器。

english: I came down here to see for myself.
Quite incredible really!

Did you come across any more machines?
I turned back at the lasers...
chinese: 我見到激光就走回頭了。

english: I didn't want to get zapped!
Quite the adventure you've been on!
chinese: 原來你經歷了一場大冒險？！

english: How you got through those lasers...
chinese: 那些激光居然能避開嗎……

english: ...you're a brave one, I'll give you that!

chinese: 我們該找天再去洞穴一趟……

english: I'd love to see how you got so far!
chinese: 我想看看你是如何走過去的！

english: Not today though... I just got back!
chinese: 不過今天就免了……我才剛剛回來！

english: What a crazy few days!
H-h-h-heeeeey! Wheere d'ya think yeeer goin'?
chinese: 哈嘿嘿嘿！尼咿為尼在去拿兒？

english: Whaaat?
Who is that? Mmmhmmm.
Y-y-y-yessss! Faaalling rocks! Deeeath!
chinese: 耶耶耶～～耶！絡絡絡石！死死！

english: Go back! Back... back... back...
Whoooo?
N-n-n-noooo. Greeeaat ciiircles of air!
chinese: 不不不。大大大圓圓圓圈圈圈！

english: Stretch to the sky! Ahhhh!
Fly awaaay litttttle boy..

chinese: ……你一個人在森林裡幹些甚麼呢？

chinese: 很危險。我勸你還是回去吧。

english: I'm just gathering some fire wood.
It gets cold at night in these mountains.
chinese: 山裡入夜後很冷，需要柴火。

english: Make sure you stay warm!
I wonder what your business is at the University.

chinese: 冬天的時候他們會找我斬柴。

english: If you walk on past the entrance, I keep some wood in the rocks.
chinese: 我存了一些柴，在大門裡面的大石那邊。

english: Someone keeps putting this shiny beaker in there.
chinese: 有人堅持不停將這個燒杯放在這兒。

english: Very strange.
Dearest Hue,
Oh, I've had the most dreadful luck.
I feel terrible that you've been left alone all this time.
The traitorous Dr. Grey tried to steal the Annular Spectrum - a ring I developed to allow perception and alteration of colour.
Some call them impossible colours. Hah! Impossible for Dr. Grey maybe.
Anyway, something went wrong.
I turned a strange shade and became invisible.
The ring... it fractured, scattering coloured shards far and wide.
I stayed at home for many weeks, watching, waiting.
Existing on this coloured plane, I couldn't speak to you, nor interact with anything in the mono-world.
So I left. I left for the University where I hid away the coloured tools I had created.
I pray you have found what is left of the ring.
Since the beginning, we have pointed to the sky and declared it blue.
It is this shared vision, this unquestioned understanding which connects us.
But are you really seeing blue the same way I see it?
Perhaps blue is nothing more than a shade of grey to you.
Perhaps everyone in this world sees nothing but shades of grey.
Don't you see Hue? This... this is why we're here.
When you enter a cave expecting a waterfall, the chances are your expectations will be met.
But if you discard those expectations, don't you think instead, the cave will be full of surprises?
I ask for you, Hue, to abandon your expectations.
To pull me back from the brink of unreality...
I need you to see the world not for what it is... but for what it can be.
Did you know, Hue, that purple is at the very end of the visible spectrum?
It's the hardest colour for our eyes to distinguish.
Now imagine... a shade one step further than purple..
A colour beyond what we can actually perceive.
We call these impossible colours...
and I fear that this... this is where I currently reside.
If reality is rooted in our perception and you cannot perceive me, do I even exist to you?
I'm sure that I do, I mean, you're reading this letter, or at least... I hope you are.
I'm sorry but... existing in this strange state of impermanence does funny things to you Hue.
It makes you question... what is real?
The University gardens were bathed in an earthy, orange light when I first met Dr. Grey.
Summer had come and gone, and a cold autumnal crispness had caught me off guard.
I sat on the grass, surrounded by my books and papers, when a cool breeze threatened to blow my notes across the lawn.
A page escaped my reach and took flight.
A man not much older than myself chased after it, catching it on his third or fourth attempt.
I remember his gentle smile when he returned it.
He started talking and I was surprised that he had read my work in the University journal.
He said he was a professor, and that... he hoped we could work together someday.
It's funny Hue... how something so small... can change so much.
Dr. Grey soon became my assigned mentor and... I can't help but feel he somehow had a hand in it.
Our fires burnt brightest when we worked together. It felt like we could achieve anything.
We discovered more about colour than I could ever have imagined.
We split light, mapped spectrums, we painted, we laughed... we worked long hours, and soon our goal became all-consuming.
We were vessels. The work became more important than us, and we knew it.
It's funny, I don't remember much after that day on the grass.
I do know that Dr. Grey and I spent many a time together.
I would compliment him on his work, and his cheeks would flush with a pinkness, hah!
He'd notice and change the subject, embarrassed.
This work we were doing together... it didn't feel much like work any more.
Did you know, Hue, that every language first has a word for black and for white, for dark and for light?
The first colour described afterwards is always... red. The colour of blood and wine. The colour of anger.
The anger I felt... when, I was told my experiments had gone too far.
When Dr. Grey sided with the University, stopping my research altogether.
For all our languages, for all our ways to communicate, it's funny how sometimes we simply cannot.
It leads people to do things they regret.
To steal, to break, to forget what is important.
Once a seed has taken root, it doesn't take long for it to grow, to nurture and blossom into something beautiful.
The seed of knowledge was planted in my mind, and I wasn't prepared to let it wilt and die.
The University claimed my experiments were unethical. That altering the fabric of our reality was dangerous.
They were unflinching. My research was confiscated and my contract terminated.
Following my expulsion, I was left with no choice but to uproot, and move us both far away.
I knew of a small fishing village, a boat ride from The University, where I hoped my reputation wouldn't precede me.
You and I moved into a humble home, which is now where you've spent most of your childhood.
Do you recall those dusty old tomes that used to sit on my desk? The ancient scriptures, of civilisations lost?
I spent hours poring over them, searching for clues to support my research.
Aside from their wonders, one thing stood out above all else... blue. Or more specifically, the absence of it.
Other colours were detailed at length; but not blue, it was never mentioned at all. The word simply didn’t exist.
Could they not distinguish blue? Without a word to describe it, how can we be sure they could see it at all?
Spring was around the corner. Yellow daffodils poked through the dirt in our backyard.
As time moved, my resentment slowly slipped away.
I continued my research from home. Without Dr. Grey, work was slow, but I still made progress.
One day, Hue, when you were sleeping... I watched over you.
I was on the cusp of a breakthrough, and you were the last person left to see it.
I was so excited... for the both of us.
My research led me to tales of a long lost civilisation.
They built great machines... pioneering electricity many years before we discovered it.
Strangely though, this civilisation is said to have felt no pain.
They knew of pain, and observed it, yet could not experience it themselves.
Explaining to them the sensation of pain, is like me explaining colour...
...to someone that can only see in black and white.
I wonder Hue, if we will be able to share in our experiences of colour.
The first time I wore the ring... I could see a coloured image of the sun.
Aqua, purple, orange, pink, red, blue, yellow and green.
Great fireworks played out across the backdrop to my reality.
Was I dreaming? Was I alive? My senses, dulled from a lifetime of monotone, struggled with the revelation.
Time eased. Colours danced in slow motion... like Pollock painting a ballet on the moon.
I removed the ring and time slipped back to normal.
Colour dissolved into grey. It was overwhelming, but what followed affected me the most.
After seeing in colour for the first time, when everything returned to normal, I could remember in colour.
I had never once before had a coloured memory.
The more I experienced, the more I realised how little I was experiencing.
Seeing the world in true colour, was not true at all.
The goalposts had just been moved a little further down an infinite playing field.
These shades... they are a paradigm away from what I could ever imagine, and yet, how much more there must be!
Is there ever such a thing as true reality, Hue? Does truth exist in our minds, the same way that colour does?
Maybe next I'll stumble upon a third-dimension. Hah! Could you imagine?!
If a tree stands in the woods, and nobody is there to see it, does that tree exist?
Does it have colour and form? Does it matter?
This journey has been difficult, Hue, and whilst I have trodden a lost, winding path...
...I feel no closer to the truth I was after. No matter how long you chase the moon...
If truth does exist in our minds, then I feel there may be one that I have neglected.
All this time, you've been alone, and now uprooted, on a journey for my cause.
For what? So I could see the world a little clearer?
I do hope in the end, it was worth it. For both of us.
Being back at the University has surfaced many memories, Hue.
I remember taking you to lectures... you would crawl to the front of the hall when I wasn’t paying attention.
Dr. Grey would look down from his lectern, and all his seriousness and authority would wash away.
He would pick you up, walk over and return you to my arms with a smile.
Love cannot be measured, Hue. Like colour, it exists inside of us. I buried it.
I buried the love that I had, for my own ends. I hope, after all this, you will see my mistakes for what they are.
Yours lovingly, Mum.
Dearest Hue, it has been too long. You have grown so much.
Your mother... I tried to warn her.
I thought that exiling her from the University would protect her... would protect you...
She did not understand that some people choose not to see.
I never stole the ring from her, Hue. I tried to destroy it... before it destroyed her.
I now know she had it under control. She knew what she was doing.
My intervention shattered the ring, altering your mother's very fabric.
My only reprieve, is that you were able to follow in her footsteps... to experience her work first-hand.
We do not see things as they are Hue, instead we see them as we are.
Your mother... she has been waiting for you. I expect she will be thrilled to see how far you've come.
P.S. You cannot always control what happens to you, but you can choose how you see it.
Now you can see true colour, you must decide if it is for better or worse.
I hope, after all this, it is for the better.
